de.affect.emotion

Class EmotionHistory

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.affect.emotion.EmotionHistory

  • public class EmotionHistory
extends java.lang.Object
    The EmotionHistory class stores a sequence of EmotionVectors, each representing the emotions of an agent at some point in time.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Patrick Gebhard (based on the work of Martin Klesen)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EmotionHistory()
      Constructs an empty history.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(EmotionVector emotions)
      Appends the specified element to the end of the history.
      void clear()
      Removes all elements from the emotion history.
      EmotionVector get(int index)
      Returns the element at the specified position in this history.
      EmotionVector getEmotionalState(EmotionVector emotions)
      Returns the emotional state of an agent by collecting the emotions with the highest intensity for each type in the history and by adding them to the specified collection.
      Emotion getEmotionByElicitor(EmotionType queryEmotionType, java.lang.Object queryElicitor)
      Returns the emotion that has the queried elicitor or null.
      EmotionVector lastElement()
      Returns the last element of the history or null if the history is empty.
      void remove(int index)
      Removes the element at the specified position in this history.
      void removeEmotionByElicitor(Emotion queryEmotion, java.lang.Object queryElicitor)
      Removes the emotion that has the queried elicitor or null.
      boolean removeFirstIfInactive()
      Removes the first EmotionVector element of the history, if the element contains no active emotion.
      int size()
      Returns the number of elements in this history.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a concise representation of the emotion history.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • EmotionHistory

        public EmotionHistory()
        Constructs an empty history.

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all elements from the emotion history.

      • add

        public void add(EmotionVector emotions)
        Appends the specified element to the end of the history. If the history is full (size() == length()) then the first element (index = 0) is removed thereby shifting any subsequent elements to the left (subtracting one from their indices) before adding the new element to the end of the history.
        Parameters:
        emotions - the emotions to be appended to this history

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of elements in this history. The size specifies the current number of elements in the emotion history.

      • get

        public EmotionVector get(int index)
        Returns the element at the specified position in this history.
        Parameters:
        index - index of element to return
        Returns:
        the element at the specified position in this history
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= size())

      • remove

        public void remove(int index)
        Removes the element at the specified position in this history. Shifts any subsequent elements to the left (subtracts one from their indices).
        Parameters:
        index - index of element to remove
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= size())

      • removeFirstIfInactive

        public boolean removeFirstIfInactive()
        Removes the first EmotionVector element of the history, if the element contains no active emotion.

      • getEmotionByElicitor

        public Emotion getEmotionByElicitor(EmotionType queryEmotionType,
                           java.lang.Object queryElicitor)
        Returns the emotion that has the queried elicitor or null. The first occurence of an emotion whoses elicitor matches the queried elicitor will be returend.
        Parameters:
        queryEmotionType - type of emotion queryElicitor the elicitor of an emotion
        Returns:
        emotion or null

      • removeEmotionByElicitor

        public void removeEmotionByElicitor(Emotion queryEmotion,
                           java.lang.Object queryElicitor)
        Removes the emotion that has the queried elicitor or null.
        Parameters:
        queryEmotion - emotion queryElicitor the elicitor of an emotion

      • lastElement

        public EmotionVector lastElement()
        Returns the last element of the history or null if the history is empty.
        Returns:
        the last element or null

      • getEmotionalState

        public EmotionVector getEmotionalState(EmotionVector emotions)
        Returns the emotional state of an agent by collecting the emotions with the highest intensity for each type in the history and by adding them to the specified collection.
        Parameters:
        emotions - the collection used to store the emotional state
        Returns:
        the new emotional state or the unmodified collection if the history is empty (size() == 0).

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a concise representation of the emotion history.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the emotion history.
